trips.title: Syunik Trips
trips.subtitle: Befriend the mountains, temples, and nature of Syunik
trips.tatev_monastery_desc: 9th-century famous monastery near Goris, registered by UNESCO
trips.meghri_church_desc: Famous church of Southern Armenia, preserved historical monument of the 17th century.
trips.meghri_fortress_desc: State palace in Meghri, a masterpiece of Armenian architecture
trips.shikahogh_desc: Reserve located in the southernmost part of Armenia, in Kapan region of Syunik, covering 29,505.845 hectares
trips.shake_waterfall_desc: Shake Waterfall is near Sisian and famous for its beautiful natural scenery and recreation places.
trips.wings_of_tatev_desc: The world's longest reversible aerial tramway (5.7 km) leading to Tatev Monastery.
trips.khndzoresk_bridge_desc: 160-meter long bridge connecting Old and New Khndzoresk, passing over the gorge.
trips.devils_bridge_desc: Natural bridge on Vorotan river with hot mineral springs.
trips.ughtasar_desc: Mountain at 3300m height with thousands of rock carvings (petroglyphs).
trips.syunik_fc_desc: Football club representing Syunik region, playing in the Armenian First League. The club is reviving Syunik's football traditions.
trips.weather_desc: Syunik has a diverse climate. Meghri is very warm (similar to subtropical), while Sisian and Goris are cooler and more humid.
trips.transport_desc: Distance from Yerevan to Syunik (Kapan) is about 300 km (4-5 hours by car). Regular minibuses also operate to all major cities.
trips.cuisine_desc: Definitely try traditional Syunik dishes: bean soups, karshm, kurkut, and mulberry vodka.
trips.select_city_msg: Select a city or place from the map for more information

kapan.name: Kapan
kapan.description: The regional center of Syunik, located at the foot of Mount Khustup.

goris.name: Goris
goris.description: A city with unique architectural style, famous for its caves.

sisian.name: Sisian
sisian.description: Located on the banks of the Vorotan River, with a rich history.

agarak.name: Agarak
agarak.description: Mining city of Syunik, famous for molybdenum and copper mines.

meghri.name: Meghri
meghri.description: Armenia's southernmost city with a mild climate.

qajaran.name: Qajaran
qajaran.description: Industrial city in Eastern Syunik, known for mining.

vayk.name: Vayk
vayk.description: Small mountain settlement, famous for Mount Babadag

attractions.0: Kapan Mining Museum - famous mining history

attractions.1: Border views - view to Iran and Azerbaijan

kapan-hiking.name: Kapan Hiking Base
kapan-hiking.description: Amazing nature amphitheater around Kapan hollow

hero.title: SYUNIK
hero.subtitle: The world of eternal mountains and unconquerable spirit

info.title: Discover Syunik
info.description_1: Syunik region is the southern gate of the Republic of Armenia, famous for its centuries-old history, powerful fortresses, and breathtaking nature. It is the fortress of Armenian statehood and spirit.
info.description_two: Here is located the world-famous Tatev Monastery and 'Wings of Tatev' aerial tramway. Syunik is also rich in natural wonders, from Shake Waterfall to Khndzoresk Swinging Bridge and Vorotan Gorge.

hero.subtitle: A heroic path coming from the depths of centuries, recorded on the mountains

kingdom.p1: The world of Syunik has been one of the strong pillars of Armenian statehood for centuries. Due to its strategic position and spiritual-cultural potential, Syunik played an important role in the formation of Armenian identity and state thinking.
kingdom.p2: In the second half of the 10th century, the Kingdom of Syunik (also known as the Kingdom of Kapan) was formed here as an independent and sovereign Armenian state. The kingdom existed until 1170, becoming a significant political, administrative, and cultural center of the region.
kingdom.p3: The capital of the kingdom, Kapan fortress city, served not only as a powerful defensive fortress but also as a center of state administration and cultural life. With its historical mission, the Kingdom of Syunik played an important role in preserving Armenian statehood and ensuring regional stability.

war.label: Struggle and Victory
war.p1: The history of Syunik is full of heroic episodes. The liberation struggle started in the early 18th century under the leadership of Davit Bek proved that in case of unity, it is possible to resist even the most powerful enemy.
war.p2: The Battle of Halidzor and the heroic battles of Mountainous Armenia led by Garegin Nzhdeh not only defended Syunik but also ensured its remaining Armenian, becoming bright examples of patriotism and military talent.

nzhdeh.label: MOUNTAINOUS ARMENIA
nzhdeh.subtitle: Garegin Nzhdeh and Immortal Spirit
nzhdeh.p1: In 1920-1921, when the existence of Armenia was in danger, Garegin Nzhdeh organized the self-defense of Mountainous Armenia in the mountains of Syunik. His iron will and strategic genius united the people of Syunik to wage a life-and-death struggle against the invaders.
nzhdeh.p2: Under Nzhdeh's leadership, Syunik became an impregnable citadel. The Republic of Mountainous Armenia was proclaimed in Tatev Monastery, which played a decisive role in preserving Syunik within Armenia.
nzhdeh.p3: “A people whose sons are not equal before the law and death will not have a victorious homeland.” With this ideology, Nzhdeh created one of the most glorious pages of Armenian history.
nzhdeh.quote: “Syunik is our backbone, without which Armenia cannot exist.”

culture.description: Syunik is known not only for its fortresses but also for its spiritual centers. Tatev Monastery and other monastic complexes of the region have been important centers of science, faith, and culture for centuries.
culture.tatev_desc: 9th-century architectural masterpiece and spiritual center of Syunik
culture.vahanavank_desc: One of the most important medieval monastic complexes of Syunik
culture.zorats_desc: Ancient observatory and unique cultural monument

privacy_policy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy_policy.introduction: This Privacy Policy describes how Syunik Dreams collects, uses, and protects your information when you use our website.
privacy_policy.collection_text: We collect information that you provide directly to us, such as when you book a tour, purchase a product, or contact us. This may include your name, email address, phone number, and payment information.
privacy_policy.usage_text: We use the information we collect to provide and improve our services, process transactions, communicate with you, and ensure a safe experience on our platform.
privacy_policy.security_text: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, or destruction.
privacy_policy.cookies_text: We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance your experience, analyze website traffic, and understand user behavior.
privacy_policy.contact_info: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at syunikdreams@gmail.com.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: We'd love to hear from you. Send us a message and we'll get back to you as soon as possible.
